result.execSummary:
The defendant Donovan Waldon Gee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property (Special Facts), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Second Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court found defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving 30 months.
Court found defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin substance Abuse program after serving 30 months.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 2.  Credit for 241 days teme

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain GED or HSED.
Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time enrollment in school or combination of both.

Batterers Intervention program or anger management program.
Anger management program

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge. Payable from defendant' sprison funds at a percentage to be determined by the Department of Corrections (DOC).  Remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived costs/fees due to indigency.
- Court set restitution at zero.

Court advised defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donovan Waldon Gee

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing Hearing exhibits from 09/15/22 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 793
Correction to Sentencing hearing on September 15, 2022. Exhibits 1, 2, 3, 4, 5; received and filed.
Exhibit List - Sentencing hearing; received and filed.
Stipulation for Destruction of Original Exhibits - Sentencing hearing; received and filed

Defendant Donovan Waldon Gee in court, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Donovan Waldon Gee.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Sentencing. State complied with Victim Notification. Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant. Additional Statements by: Kristina M. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  
Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of FOUR (4) YEARS, Concurrent to AMENDED COUNT 2, with credit for 241 DAYS time served. 
The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is TWO (2) YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is TWO (2) YEARS.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 2:  
Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of SEVEN (7) YEARS.
The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is FOUR (4) YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is THREE (3) YEARS.  

Court found Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program, after serving 30 MONTHS.
Court found Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, after serving 30 MONTHS.
 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- Obtain GED or HSED.
- Batterers Intervention Program or Anger Management Program.
- Anger Management Program.
- Obtain/Maintain Full-Time Employment or Full-Time Enrollment in School, or combination of both.

Court set Restitution at ZERO. 

Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA SAMPLE and pay DNA SURCHARGE, payable from Defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the Department of Corrections (DOC). Remainder to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court WAIVED COSTS/FEES due to Indigency. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 
Court advised Defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

FILED: Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Filed: Original Transcript of Motion Hearing ( 45 pages) commencing 04-26-2022 by Kelly Janowski.

ORDER REINSTATING COMMUNICATION PRIVILEGES; signed, filed, and distributed. Clerk provided copy to MCSO.

IT IS ORDERED that the Defendants communication privileges while in the custody of the Sheriff of Milwaukee County, previously revoked relative to the above-entitled case, be reinstated forthwith. 
Specifically, Donovan Gee shall have his US Mail, telephone, and visitation privileges reinstated in full.
Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Donovan Waldon Gee in Court with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Donovan Waldon Gee in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

STATE FILED AN AMENDED INFORMATION. Defense waived reading of the Amended Information, and temporarily entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 2: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Amended Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 

Court RESTORED DEFENDANT'S TELEPHONE, VISITATION, AND U.S. MAIL CUSTODY PRIVILEGES. Defense to submit an Order to the Court. 

Court VACATED SPEEDY Jury Trial date. 

Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing, Branch 46. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form, and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

-received, filed, and distributed. Defense and Defendant received a copy. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Remains as originally charged, Plea hearing was held July 11, 2022. 

AS TO COUNT 2: On Motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 AMENDED TO SECOND DEGREE RECKLESSLY ENDANGERING SAFETY, USE OF A DANGEROUS WEPAON, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes Section(s) 941.30(2), 939.50(3)(g), 939.63(1)(b), a Class G Felony.

Clerk contacted the parties via email regarding Final PreTrial. 
NEW DATE: Final PreTrial scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:45 pm. 
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Information provided to MCSO.

Defendant Donovan Waldon Gee in Court with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Donovan Waldon Gee in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Donovan Waldon Gee in Court with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Donovan Waldon Gee in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Conference held in chambers. Discussion placed on the record. State requested an adjournment to investigate potential witness intimidation. Defense objected. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED State's request for an adjournment. Court TOLLED TIME LIMITS. Defense re-entered a Demand for Speedy Trial. Parties selected new dates. Additionally, State requested to revoke Defendant's telephone and mail privileges. Defense objected. Arguments heard. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED State's request to revoke Defendant's telephone and mail privileges. Court will revisit the State's Motion. Court ordered case adjourned for Motion hearing, Final PreTrial, and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Motion hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 11:20 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Final PreTrial scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:15 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Donovan Waldon Gee in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Donovan Waldon Gee in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Case recalled. As parties have reached a resolution on COUNT 1. Parties are ready to proceed with trial on COUNT 2. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 

Clerk contacted Jury Management, Case passed.

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Defendant and State appeared via Zoom Video Conference. Defense appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Court reviewed Defense Motion to Modify Bail. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense Motion to Modify Bail.

Defense received partial discovery material from the State. Defense did NOT receive an offer. Defense advised the Court of Motion to Suppress. Court set the following deadlines: Defense Motion is due on or before March 30, 2022. State Response is due on or before April 20, 2022. State to provide the Court with Defendant's recorded statements. Court ordered case adjourned for Motion hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective E. Fitting.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Next date provided by the clerk in Br. 46.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Defense Motion to Review Bail; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
received and filed.

Defendant Donovan Waldon Gee not in court, defendant in custody.   Student Intern Tristan Bednarek under the supervision of Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with ELD, dob 8/27/00 and KDM, dob 9/16/01
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Donovan Waldon Gee in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Donovan Waldon Gee in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donovan Waldon Gee appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
